result.execSummary:
The defendant David Ray Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not possess any needles or syringes for any other purpose other than medical.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Granted release privileges under 303.08(1).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Ray Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Bond Terminated Slip  
C: WC Jail

Defendant David Ray Rodriguez appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Adam Raabe appeared in court for David Ray Rodriguez, Attorney Nicholas William Bolz appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives PH. Court questions defendant and counsel.
Court finds defendant is waiving PH.  
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over. 
Information filed.  Waives reading.  
Plea Guilty.
Plea quest. provided to the Court. 
Court questions defendant and counsel on Plea quest. 
Court finds defendant is waiving his const. rights.
Court finds the defendant guilty.
Stmt. ADA and Atty. Raabe sentencing.
Court orders  sentence imposed and stayed of 3 1/2 years with 18 months of confinement and 18 months of ext. supervision; 
places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years,  conditions of probation - pay any costs and supervision fees, submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations, shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Ch. 961, shall not posses any needles or syringes for any other purpose other than medical, possess prescription medication only by valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician, County jail 90 days jail time stayed to be used at Agents discretion.  
46 days credit revoked; defendant is eligible for substance abuse program. 
Court informs defendant of rights of firearm possession and voting.
Post conviction relief.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Danuta Kurczewski, ADA present
Attorney Adam Raabe present - via Zoom.
Defendant present - in custody - via Zoom.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Bond continued.
PH 3/2/22 at 9:15 am
Zoom - Attorney Raabe and defendant - in custody

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David Ray Rodriguez appeared via zoom, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas William Bolz appeared in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Katena Roberts-Turner appeared in court on behalf of Defendant David Ray Rodriguez.
Court orders warrant quashed.
Per Atty. Roberts-Turner - defendant qualifies for SPD appointment.
Complaint received, reading waived.
Statements by ADA Bolz and Atty. Roberts-Turner re: bond.
Court orders 2000.00 signature bond - see bond for conditions.
Court continues matter until 2-22-2022 @ 1:30 PM - AIA w/1970
